newsitem.title: USA: Former Secretary of State George Shultz weds.
newsitem.headline: Former Secretary of State George Shultz weds.

text.p: Former Secretary of State George Shultz and a San Francisco socialite have tied the knot in what was being called the city's wedding of the year.

Shultz and Charlotte Mailliard Swig were married at San Francisco's Grace Cathedral on Friday evening, attended by a select group of guests including former first lady Nancy Reagan, Gov. Pete Wilson, Sen. Dianne Feinstein and San Francisco Mayor Willie Brown.
Swig wore a yellow gown and a star-shaped Chanel diamond ring that Shultz gave her. The red-carpet ceremony was followed by a glittering reception for 650 guests.
"We're going to have a honeymoon and it's going to go on for years and years and years," Shultz told reporters.
Shultz, 76, was secretary of state in the Reagan administration from 1982 to 1989 and is now a scholar at the Hoover Institution at Stanford University. His first wife died in 1995.
The twice-widowed Swig, 64, is San Francisco's protocol chief, involved in organizing city events. A wealthy woman with four homes, she is a star of San Francisco's social scene.
Feinstein was matchmaker for the couple, who got to know each other when the Democratic senator placed them together at a dinner party.
